abstract: Senior Russian general Nikolai Makarov, in speech at conference in Moscow, threatens pre-emptive attacks on missile-defense sites in Poland and elsewhere in Eastern Europe in the event of a crisis; remarks come as Vladimir Putin prepares to assume the presidency and might signal a move to a more muscular foreign policy. (M)i

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER; Ellen Barry contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: MOSCOW -- A senior Russian general threatened on Wednesday pre-emptive attacks on missile-defense sites in Poland and elsewhere in Eastern Europe in the event of a crisis, underscoring the Kremlin's opposition to the Obama administration's plans and further undermining relations between the countries. While Russian officials have said previously that the antimissile sites could become targets in the event of war, the threat of a pre-emptive attack was new.

headline.main: Russian General Makes Threat on Missile-Defense Sites
